title: Asmodeus' Lair (SpliceHack)
data:
| Asmodeus' Lair                                      |                                                    |
| --------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 2–7 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | Yes                                                |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                                |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No, when Asmodeus is on level                      |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                 |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                 |

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), **[Asmodeus' Lair](/wiki/Asmodeus%27_Lair "Asmodeus' Lair")** has its layout changed significantly, and uses a map based on [the second map for the level](/wiki/Asmodeus%27_Lair_\(UnNetHack\) "Asmodeus' Lair (UnNetHack)") in [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), which in turn is base on [the Lethe patch map](/wiki/Gehennom_\(Lethe_patch\)#Asmodeus.27_lair "Gehennom (Lethe patch)").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Map](#Map)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 See also](#See_also)
- [4 References](#References)

There are four random pieces of [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor"), four random [weapons](/wiki/Weapons "Weapons"), two random [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion") and three random [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll") scattered across the level. The floor and all walls are [undiggable](/wiki/Undiggable "Undiggable").

The room containing the up [stair](/wiki/Stair "Stair") has a cursed -2 [helm of opposite alignment](/wiki/Helm_of_opposite_alignment "Helm of opposite alignment") on the stairway's square, a cursed [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone") and a cursed [amulet of strangulation](/wiki/Amulet_of_strangulation "Amulet of strangulation") on the adjacent square below it, and an [imp](/wiki/Imp "Imp") in the corner to the right of the stairway.

A path leads from this room to a set of double [doors](/wiki/Door "Door"), and behind them is an outer room, which has two [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap"), two [magic traps](/wiki/Magic_trap "Magic trap"), a [spiked pit](/wiki/Spiked_pit "Spiked pit"), and an [anti-magic trap](/wiki/Anti-magic_trap "Anti-magic trap") at the marked locations—there is a [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph") on the square north of the anti-magic trap, a cursed [scroll of elementalism](/wiki/Scroll_of_elementalism "Scroll of elementalism") in the northwest corner, and a single [gold piece](/wiki/Gold_piece "Gold piece") on each of the three marked squares and the anti-magic trap's square. The left pair of doors lead to a two-square room that contains a [land mine](/wiki/Land_mine "Land mine") and a magic trap, both with a single gold piece on each of their squares; the land mine also has a cursed [scroll of earth](/wiki/Scroll_of_earth "Scroll of earth") on its square, while the magic trap also has a cursed [scroll of fire](/wiki/Scroll_of_fire "Scroll of fire") on its square.

A set of [secret corridors](/wiki/Secret_corridor "Secret corridor") branching north from the hallway between the up stair room and trap room leads to the outer chamber, which has four [hell hounds](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound"). To the east is a closet, and two other hallways branch out from the north and west parts of the room: the north hallway has a [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") in the middle of it and leads to a room with a [blue jelly](/wiki/Blue_jelly "Blue jelly"); the west hallway is blocked by a secret corridor that has a [scroll of teleportation](/wiki/Scroll_of_teleportation "Scroll of teleportation") in front of it. This west hallway leads to a room that has six [fountains](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain"), four random [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") and two random [V](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)"), with a [fire trap](/wiki/Fire_trap "Fire trap") between the rightmost pair of fountains and a [rust trap](/wiki/Rust_trap "Rust trap") between the center pair—this room is connected to a group of [lemure pits](/wiki/Lemure_pit "Lemure pit") (marked with "lmr") by a pair of closed [drawbridges](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge") placed over a river of [moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat") squares that divides the level into halves.

Beyond the lemure pits is a set of rooms similar to the central structure of Asmodeus' Lair in *NetHack*: an anti-magic trap and [sleeping gas trap](/wiki/Sleeping_gas_trap "Sleeping gas trap") are placed at the marked locations at the first room, and the north doorway leads into a narrower room with a [secret door](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door") partway through. The next room contains a spiked pit with a secret door leading into another room, which in turn has a secret door leading to a fake "throne room" like the one that Asmodeus normally occupies in *NetHack*. This room has a [giant mimic](/wiki/Giant_mimic "Giant mimic") in the guise of the down stair with four magic traps surrounding it, and a random [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") is generated in each corner with a [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") on their square. A secret door in the southern wall of the false "throne room" leads to a 3x4 room that has three fire traps, three [squeaky boards](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board"), and two sleeping [barbed devils](/wiki/Barbed_devil "Barbed devil") [named](/wiki/Named "Named") Gogmelon and Ulgaxicus—its southern walls consist entirely of doors leading to the real throne room (not to be confused with the [special room type](/wiki/Throne_room "Throne room")).

Within the throne room is Asmodeus himself, standing on the square directly north of the down stair—to the direct south is a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") with an [incubus](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus") asleep on its square. A pair of sleeping [mariliths](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith") named Voran and Joggeruuth are generated to the left of them, and a pair of sleeping succubi are generated to the right. A secret door on the east wall leads into a series of branching corridors that contain a magic trap, a fire trap, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap—this leads to a small treasure room containing an [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change") and a cursed [ring of hunger](/wiki/Ring_of_hunger "Ring of hunger"), along with three piles of 500 gold pieces that are each accompanied by a random [&](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") and a named cursed [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem"):

- a [diamond](/wiki/Diamond "Diamond") named The Tears of Koth
- a [ruby](/wiki/Ruby "Ruby") named The Heart of Cassanova
- an [emerald](/wiki/Emerald "Emerald") named The Eye of Hera

## Strategy

Having a means of opening or demolishing the drawbridges may be useful.

With the possible exception of the helm of opposite alignment, most of the loot on this level is of limited use to a late-game character.

There are likely to be a lot of demons (and perhaps Asmodeus himself) crowded in the 3x4 hallway with the squeaky boards and fire traps. It's a good place to cast an area-of-effect [attack spell](/wiki/Attack_spell "Attack spell"), such as [psystrike](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_psystrike\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of psystrike (page does not exist)") or [sonicboom](/index.php?title=Spellbook_of_sonicboom\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spellbook of sonicboom (page does not exist)").

## See also

- [SpliceHack/Special levels](/wiki/SpliceHack/Special_levels "SpliceHack/Special levels")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [SpliceHack-Rewrite 1.2.0 - asmodeus.lua](https://github.com/NullCGT/SpliceHack/blob/Spl-R-1.2.0/dat/asmodeus.lua)

Asmodeus' Lair (SpliceHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Asmodeus' Lair
Location Level 2–7 of
Gehennom
Bones Yes
Mappable Yes
Teleportable No, when Asmodeus is on level
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls No

In SpliceHack, Asmodeus' Lair has its layout changed significantly, and uses a map based on the second map for the level in UnNetHack, which in turn is base on the Lethe patch map.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Map
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Map

There are four random pieces of armor, four random weapons, two random potions and three random scrolls scattered across the level. The floor and all walls are undiggable.

The room containing the up stair has a cursed -2 helm of opposite alignment on the stairway's square, a cursed loadstone and a cursed amulet of strangulation on the adjacent square below it, and an imp in the corner to the right of the stairway.

A path leads from this room to a set of double doors, and behind them is an outer room, which has two fire traps, two magic traps, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap at the marked locations—there is a potion of polymorph on the square north of the anti-magic trap, a cursed scroll of elementalism in the northwest corner, and a single gold piece on each of the three marked squares and the anti-magic trap's square. The left pair of doors lead to a two-square room that contains a land mine and a magic trap, both with a single gold piece on each of their squares; the land mine also has a cursed scroll of earth on its square, while the magic trap also has a cursed scroll of fire on its square.

A set of secret corridors branching north from the hallway between the up stair room and trap room leads to the outer chamber, which has four hell hounds. To the east is a closet, and two other hallways branch out from the north and west parts of the room: the north hallway has a polymorph trap in the middle of it and leads to a room with a blue jelly; the west hallway is blocked by a secret corridor that has a scroll of teleportation in front of it. This west hallway leads to a room that has six fountains, four random & and two random V, with a fire trap between the rightmost pair of fountains and a rust trap between the center pair—this room is connected to a group of lemure pits (marked with "lmr") by a pair of closed drawbridges placed over a river of moat squares that divides the level into halves.

Beyond the lemure pits is a set of rooms similar to the central structure of Asmodeus' Lair in NetHack: an anti-magic trap and sleeping gas trap are placed at the marked locations at the first room, and the north doorway leads into a narrower room with a secret door partway through. The next room contains a spiked pit with a secret door leading into another room, which in turn has a secret door leading to a fake "throne room" like the one that Asmodeus normally occupies in NetHack. This room has a giant mimic in the guise of the down stair with four magic traps surrounding it, and a random & is generated in each corner with a potion of invisibility on their square. A secret door in the southern wall of the false "throne room" leads to a 3x4 room that has three fire traps, three squeaky boards, and two sleeping barbed devils named Gogmelon and Ulgaxicus—its southern walls consist entirely of doors leading to the real throne room (not to be confused with the special room type).

Within the throne room is Asmodeus himself, standing on the square directly north of the down stair—to the direct south is a throne with an incubus asleep on its square. A pair of sleeping mariliths named Voran and Joggeruuth are generated to the left of them, and a pair of sleeping succubi are generated to the right. A secret door on the east wall leads into a series of branching corridors that contain a magic trap, a fire trap, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap—this leads to a small treasure room containing an amulet of change and a cursed ring of hunger, along with three piles of 500 gold pieces that are each accompanied by a random & and a named cursed gem:

  • a diamond named The Tears of Koth
  • a ruby named The Heart of Cassanova
  • an emerald named The Eye of Hera

Strategy

Having a means of opening or demolishing the drawbridges may be useful.

With the possible exception of the helm of opposite alignment, most of the loot on this level is of limited use to a late-game character.

There are likely to be a lot of demons (and perhaps Asmodeus himself) crowded in the 3x4 hallway with the squeaky boards and fire traps. It's a good place to cast an area-of-effect attack spell, such as psystrike or sonicboom.

See also

  • SpliceHack/Special levels

&=[[Demon (monster class)|{{white|&}}]] 4={{msl|giant mimic}} M=[[magic trap|{{magenta|^}}]] B=[[squeaky board|{{brown|^}}]] R=[[fire trap|{{brightred|^}}]] D=[[drawbridge|{{brown|#}}]] P=[[spiked pit|{{darkgray|^}}]] L=[[sleeping gas trap|{{brightblue|^}}]] A=[[anti-magic field|{{brightblue|^}}]] N=[[land mine|{{red|^}}]] "=[[amulet of change|{{yellow|"}}]] o=[[ring of hunger|{{yellow|=}}]] 5={{msl|incubus}} 6={{msl|barbed devil}} 7={{msl|succubus}} 8={{msl|marilith}} 9={{msl|Asmodeus}} i={{msl|imp}} d={{msl|hell hound}} j={{msl|blue jelly}} ?=[[scroll of elementalism|{{white|?}}]] V=[[Vampire (monster class)|{{white|V}}]] ?=[[scroll of teleportation|{{white|?}}]] p=[[polymorph trap|{{brightgreen|^}}]] *=[[loadstone|{{gray|*}}]] !=[[potion of polymorph|{{yellow|!}}]] t=[[rust trap|{{blue|^}}]] $=[[zorkmid|{{yellow|$}}]] }}}} ---- -------------------- ------- |}}}}-- |j.| |............S.....| |.....|------ --}}}}-------------- ##y##+..| |---+-----------...| |.lmr.|.....|------}}}}|...........| # |..| |.....|&......&|-+------|.....|.lmr.|.lmr.F}}}}F.&..&..V...| ---+--- ---- |..---|....M...|...L....|.....|.....|.....|}}}}|..{..{..{..| |...d.| |..|..S..M.4.M.|.....A....................|D.|D.........R..+##H#S..d.dS# |..|..|....M...|........|.....|.....|.....|}}}}|..{..{..{..| |...d.| |.P|..|&......&|-&------|.....|.lmr.|.lmr.F}}}}F.&..&..V...| ---+--- |..|..-----S----...| |.lmr.|.....|------}}}}|...........| H |..S.....|R.R|.....| |.....|------ |}}}}-------------- H ---------|.R.|------ ------- --}}}}| -------- H |BBB| ### |}}}}----|?$M...| # |6.6| # #P# }}}}| |M+pP.$R.+########### -----+++----- #### # # }}}} |N+A.M.R.+########### |...........| # ###### ---- }}}} --|..$...| # |..8..9..7..S##### # # |"$| }}}} -------- ---+--- |...8.>.7...| # # ###+.$| }}}} |<...i| |.....5.....| ####### |o$| }}}} |*....| ------------- ---- }}}} -------
There are four random pieces of [[armor]], four random [[weapons]], two random [[potion]]s and three random [[scroll]]s scattered across the level. The floor and all walls are [[undiggable]]. The room containing the up [[stair]] has a cursed -2 [[helm of opposite alignment]] on the stairway's square, a cursed [[loadstone]] and a cursed [[amulet of strangulation]] on the adjacent square below it, and an [[imp]] in the corner to the right of the stairway. A path leads from this room to a set of double [[door]]s, and behind them is an outer room, which has two [[fire trap]]s, two [[magic trap]]s, a [[spiked pit]], and an [[anti-magic trap]] at the marked locations—there is a [[potion of polymorph]] on the square north of the anti-magic trap, a cursed [[scroll of elementalism]] in the northwest corner, and a single [[gold piece]] on each of the three marked squares and the anti-magic trap's square. The left pair of doors lead to a two-square room that contains a [[land mine]] and a magic trap, both with a single gold piece on each of their squares; the land mine also has a cursed [[scroll of earth]] on its square, while the magic trap also has a cursed [[scroll of fire]] on its square. A set of [[secret corridor]]s branching north from the hallway between the up stair room and trap room leads to the outer chamber, which has four [[hell hound]]s. To the east is a closet, and two other hallways branch out from the north and west parts of the room: the north hallway has a [[polymorph trap]] in the middle of it and leads to a room with a [[blue jelly]]; the west hallway is blocked by a secret corridor that has a [[scroll of teleportation]] in front of it. This west hallway leads to a room that has six [[fountain]]s, four random {{mcsl|&}} and two random {{mcsl|V}}, with a [[fire trap]] between the rightmost pair of fountains and a [[rust trap]] between the center pair—this room is connected to a group of [[lemure pit]]s (marked with "lmr") by a pair of closed [[drawbridge]]s placed over a river of [[moat]] squares that divides the level into halves. Beyond the lemure pits is a set of rooms similar to the central structure of Asmodeus' Lair in ''NetHack'': an anti-magic trap and [[sleeping gas trap]] are placed at the marked locations at the first room, and the north doorway leads into a narrower room with a [[secret door]] partway through. The next room contains a spiked pit with a secret door leading into another room, which in turn has a secret door leading to a fake "throne room" like the one that Asmodeus normally occupies in ''NetHack''. This room has a [[giant mimic]] in the guise of the down stair with four magic traps surrounding it, and a random {{mcsl|&}} is generated in each corner with a [[potion of invisibility]] on their square. A secret door in the southern wall of the false "throne room" leads to a 3x4 room that has three fire traps, three [[squeaky board]]s, and two sleeping [[barbed devil]]s [[named]] Gogmelon and Ulgaxicus—its southern walls consist entirely of doors leading to the real throne room (not to be confused with the [[Throne room|special room type]]). Within the throne room is Asmodeus himself, standing on the square directly north of the down stair—to the direct south is a [[throne]] with an [[incubus]] asleep on its square. A pair of sleeping [[marilith]]s named Voran and Joggeruuth are generated to the left of them, and a pair of sleeping succubi are generated to the right. A secret door on the east wall leads into a series of branching corridors that contain a magic trap, a fire trap, a spiked pit, and an anti-magic trap—this leads to a small treasure room containing an [[amulet of change]] and a cursed [[ring of hunger]], along with three piles of 500 gold pieces that are each accompanied by a random {{mcsl|&}} and a named cursed [[gem]]: * a [[diamond]] named The Tears of Koth * a [[ruby]] named The Heart of Cassanova * an [[emerald]] named The Eye of Hera ==Strategy== Having a means of opening or demolishing the drawbridges may be useful. With the possible exception of the helm of opposite alignment, most of the loot on this level is of limited use to a late-game character. There are likely to be a lot of demons (and perhaps Asmodeus himself) crowded in the 3x4 hallway with the squeaky boards and fire traps. It's a good place to cast an area-of-effect [[attack spell]], such as {{+ of|psystrike}} or {{+ of|sonicboom}}. ==See also== * [[SpliceHack/Special levels]] ==References== [[Category:SpliceHack special levels]]
